<summary>What's your diagnosis</summary>

Endobronchial Granular Cell Tumor

</details>

<details close>

<summary>Notes</summary>
<br>
**Synonym:** <br>Abrikossoff tumor
<br><br>
**Epidemiology:** All ages, but peak in 4th-6th decade, slightly more common in females
<br><br>
**Dignity:** <br>typically benign, but may be malignant - no histological criteria to predict biological behaviour
<br><br>
**Microscopy:** <br>Nuclear atypia may be present. Overlying pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia may be observed.
<br><br>
**Reference:** <br>https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lungtumorgranularcelltumor.html 

</details>
